verses.text: 呼召四個門徒耶穌站在革尼撒勒湖邊，眾人擁擠他，要聽 神的道。

words.note: Lit. 'door apprentice'
The preceding ideographic space (　) indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 他看見兩隻船停在湖邊，漁夫離開船洗網去了。

words.note: Verb-object compound specific to fishing context.

verses.text: 他上了西門的那一隻船，請他撐開，離岸不遠，就坐下，從船上教導眾人。

words.note: Verb-object compound

verses.text: 講完了，就對西門說：「把船開到水深的地方，下網打魚！」

words.note: Indicates object is moved or affected
Verb-object compound specific to fishing context.
Verb-object compound

verses.text: 西門說：「主啊，我們整夜勞苦，毫無所得，不過，我願照你的話下網。」

words.note: Verb-object compound specific to fishing context.

verses.text: 他們下了網，就圈住很多魚，網幾乎裂開，
就招呼另外那隻船上的同伴來幫助，他們就來把兩隻船裝滿，甚至船要下沉。
西門．彼得看見這種情景，就俯伏在耶穌膝前，說：「主啊，離開我，因為我是個罪人。」

words.note: To bow down, prostrate, showing reverence or submission.
Refers to God or Jesus in a religious context.
A person who commits sin, a core biblical concept.

verses.text: 他和跟他在一起的人，因這網所打的魚，都十分驚駭。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or agent of an action.
Used in the context of '打魚' (to catch fish).
Lit. 'ten parts,' meaning completely or fully.
Implies a strong sense of awe mixed with fear.

verses.text: 西門的夥伴，西庇太的兒子雅各、約翰也是這樣。耶穌對西門說：「不要怕！從今以後，你要作得人的漁夫了。」

words.note: Biblical metaphor for winning people for God's kingdom ('fishers of men').
Used metaphorically here as 'fisher of men'.

verses.text: 他們把兩隻船攏了岸，撇下一切，跟從了耶穌。

words.note: Verb 攏 (to pull towards, gather) with aspect particle 了.
Often used in religious contexts for discipleship.

verses.text: 治好痲風病人有一次，耶穌在一個城裡，突然有一個滿身痲風的人看見他，就把臉伏在地上，求他說：「主啊！如果你肯，必能使我潔淨。」

words.note: Lit. 'leprosy sick person'. 痲風 is leprosy.
伏 indicates a humble or submissive posture.

words.definition: surely can, must be able to

verses.text: 耶穌伸手摸他，說：「我肯，你潔淨了吧！」痲風立刻離開了他。

words.note: Verb-object compound: to extend one's hand.

verses.text: 耶穌囑咐他不可告訴任何人，「你只要去給祭司檢查，並且照著摩西所規定的，為你得潔淨獻祭，好向大家作證。」

words.definition: only need to, just need to

words.note: Forms a noun phrase when placed before a verb, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
Verb-object compound, often used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 但他的名聲卻越發傳揚出去，成群的人來聚集，要聽道，並且要使他們的疾病痊愈。

words.note: Directional complement, indicating movement away from the speaker.
Verb-object compound. 道 here refers to God's word or teaching.

verses.text: 耶穌卻退到曠野去禱告。
治好癱子有一天，耶穌正在教導人，法利賽人和律法教師也坐在那裡，他們是從加利利和猶太各鄉村，並耶路撒冷來的；主的能力與他同在，叫他能醫病。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in Christian context.

verses.text: 有人用床抬著一個癱子，想送進去，放在耶穌跟前。
因為人多，沒有辦法進去，就上了房頂，從瓦間把癱子和床往當中縋下去，正在耶穌跟前。
他看見他們的信心，就說：「朋友（「朋友」原文作「人」），你的罪赦了。」
經學家和法利賽人就議論起來，說：「這人是誰，竟然說僭妄的話？除 神一位以外，誰能赦罪呢？」

words.note: Refers to Jewish scholars of the Law.
Verb complement indicating initiation or upward movement.
The space often precedes 神 in Chinese Bibles to show reverence.

verses.text: 耶穌知道他們的議論，就對他們說：「你們心裡為甚麼議論呢？
說：『你的罪赦了』，或說：『起來行走』，哪一樣容易呢？

words.note: Here means 'which one' (of the two options).

verses.text: 然而為了要你們知道，人子在地上有赦罪的權柄，（他就對癱子說：）我吩咐你，起來，拿起你的床，回家去吧。」

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: A title Jesus often used for himself.
Can also act as a directional complement.

verses.text: 那人立刻當眾起來，拿著他躺過的床，頌讚 神，回家去了。

words.note: The space often precedes 神 in Chinese Bibles to show reverence.
Can also act as a directional complement.

verses.text: 眾人都驚奇，頌讚 神，並且十分懼怕，說：「我們今天看見了不平常的事。」

words.note: Lit. 'ten parts'

verses.text: 呼召利未事後，耶穌出去，看見一個稅吏，名叫利未，坐在稅關那裡，就對他說：「來跟從我！」

words.note: Often used for a divine calling in religious contexts.

verses.text: 他就撇下一切，起來跟從了耶穌。
利未在自己家裡，為他大擺筵席，有許多稅吏和別的人一起吃飯。

words.note: 筵席 (yánxí) means banquet. 大擺 (dàbǎi) means to grandly arrange.

verses.text: 法利賽人和經學家埋怨他的門徒，說：「你們為甚麼跟稅吏和罪人一起吃喝呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'door student/follower'

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「健康的人不需要醫生，有病的人才需要。

words.note: Lit. 'have illness', often functions as an adjective.

verses.text: 我來不是要召義人，而是要召罪人悔改。」

words.note: Refers to those considered righteous by God.
Refers to those who have sinned.
Lit. 'regret and change'.

verses.text: 新舊的比喻他們說：「約翰的門徒常常禁食、祈禱，法利賽人的門徒也是這樣，而你的門徒卻又吃又喝。」

words.note: Lit. 'forbid eating'.
A compound verb meaning 'to pray'.
A Jewish sect in ancient Judea.
Used in '又...又...' structure for 'both...and...'
Used in '又...又...' structure for 'both...and...'

verses.text: 耶穌說：「新郎跟賓客在一起的時候，你們怎麼可以叫賓客禁食呢？

words.note: In Bible, refers to Jesus as the bridegroom.

verses.text: 但日子到了，新郎要被取去，離開他們，那一天他們就要禁食了。」

words.note: Indicates change of state or completion.

verses.text: 他又對他們設個比喻說：「沒有人會從新衣服撕下一塊布，補在舊衣服上，如果這樣，不但新衣服撕破了，而且新撕下的布，也和舊的不調和。

words.note: A story used to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson.
了 indicates completion or change of state.
Acts as an adjective here, describing the cloth.
Used as a nominalizer here, meaning 'the old one'.

verses.text: 也沒有人會把新酒裝在舊皮袋裡；如果這樣，新酒就會把皮袋脹破，不但酒漏掉，皮袋也損壞了；

words.note: Indicates the object is acted upon and moved or changed.
Specifically refers to animal skin bags used for wine in ancient times.
了 indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 人總是把新酒裝在新皮袋裡。
喝慣陳酒的人，就不想喝新酒，他總說陳的好。」

words.note: Specifically refers to things that are old, especially wine, sometimes implying quality.
Here '的' turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, meaning 'those who are accustomed to drinking old wine'.
Here '陳' is nominalized by '的', meaning 'the old one' (i.e., old wine).
